header.gameNote: WILLIAM amp; MARY TIP-OFF CLASSIC AT WILLIAMSBURG VA

article.headline: Cornell 99, Virginia Military 94
article.story: WILLIAMSBURG, Va. (AP) -- Louis Dale and Ryan Wittman each had 18 points to lead Cornell to a 99-94 win over VMI in the William & Mary Tip-Off Classic on Friday night. The Big Red (4-3) had a total of seven players in double figures and kept the Keydets (3-6) to 36.4 percent from the field. VMI led 54-46 at halftime and faced a back-and-forth battle early in the second, keeping an 89-88 lead with 2:45 to play. Cornell took a 97-92 lead with 15 seconds left on a pair of free throws from Dale. Reggie Williams brought VMI to within three, but another pair of Dale free throws gave the Big Red a 5-point lead with nine seconds to play. Williams led the Keydets with 41 points and 16 rebounds, Chavis Holmes had 27 and Matt Murrer added 14. Williams set a Kaplan Arena scoring record, and VMI set records for its 19 3-pointers and 54 3-point attempts. Cornell will play William & Mary on Saturday in the finals; VMI will play Jacksonville State in the consolation game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
